Int64AnimationBase Class

Definition

Abstract class that, when implemented, animates a Int64 value.

In this Article

public abstract class Int64AnimationBase : System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline

Examples

The following code example demonstrates how to use the DoubleAnimationUsingKeyFrames class in Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML), but generically shows how to use other derived classes such as Int64AnimationUsingKeyFrames. 

This snippet ID altdoubleanimationusingkeyframeswholepage is used in multiple files: /CS/AltDoubleAnimationUsingKeyFramesExample.xaml, /XAML/AltDoubleAnimationUsingKeyFramesExample.xaml. Rename the duplicate ID to make it unique, and update the reference to the snippet ID in the topic(s).

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this Int64AnimationBase, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Animation.Int64AnimationBase Clone ();
Returns
Int64AnimationBase

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

GetCurrentValue(Int64, Int64, AnimationClock)

Gets the current value of the animation.

public long GetCurrentValue (long defaultOriginValue, long defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);
Parameters
defaultOriginValue
Int64

The origin value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own start value.

defaultDestinationValue
Int64

The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.

animationClock
AnimationClock

The AnimationClock which can generate the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime* or stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* value to be used by the animation to generate its output value.

Returns
Int64

The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

Remarks

The value of the defaultOriginValue parameter depends on the animation’s position in the composition chain:

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and it replaces another animation, defaultOriginValue is the output of that animation at the time it was replaced.

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and no animation exists to replace, defaultOriginValue is the base value of the animated property.

  • If this animation is not in the first position of a composition chain, then defaultOriginValue is the value that is returned by the previous animation in the composition chain that has an AnimationClock that is not Stopped.

    The value of the defaultDestinationValue parameter depends on whether there is a previous property Trigger composition layer.

  • If there is a previous property Trigger composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the output from that layer.

  • If there is no previous composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the base value of the property that you are animating.

    For more information about animation composition, see the Animation and Timing System Overview. For more information about creating custom animation types, see the Custom Animations Overview.

GetCurrentValue(Object, Object, AnimationClock)

Gets the current value of the animation.

Returns
Object

The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

Remarks

The value of the defaultOriginValue parameter depends on the animation’s position in the composition chain:

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and it replaces another animation, defaultOriginValue is the output of that animation at the time it was replaced.

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and no animation exists to replace, defaultOriginValue is the base value of the animated property.

  • If this animation is not in the first position of a composition chain, then defaultOriginValue is the value that is returned by the previous animation in the composition chain that has an AnimationClock that is not Stopped.

    The value of the defaultDestinationValue parameter depends on whether there is a previous property Trigger composition layer.

  • If there is a previous property Trigger composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the output from that layer.

  • If there is no previous composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the base value of the property that you are animating.

    For more information about animation composition, see the Animation and Timing System Overview. For more information about creating custom animation types, see the Custom Animations Overview.

GetCurrentValueCore(Int64, Int64, AnimationClock)

Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by the host animation.

protected abstract long GetCurrentValueCore (long defaultOriginValue, long defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);
Parameters
defaultOriginValue
Int64

The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.

defaultDestinationValue
Int64

The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.

animationClock
AnimationClock

An AnimationClock that generates the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentTime* or stem.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.CurrentProgress* used by the host animation.

Returns
Int64

The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current animation.

Remarks

The value of the defaultOriginValue parameter depends on the animation’s position in the composition chain:

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and it replaces another animation, defaultOriginValue is the output of that animation at the time it was replaced.

  • If the animation is in the first position in a composition chain and no animation exists to replace, defaultOriginValue is the base value of the animated property.

  • If this animation is not in the first position of a composition chain, then defaultOriginValue is the value that is returned by the previous animation in the composition chain that has an AnimationClock that is not Stopped.

    The value of the defaultDestinationValue parameter depends on whether there is a previous property Trigger composition layer.

  • If there is a previous property Trigger composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the output from that layer.

  • If there is no previous composition layer, defaultDestinationValue is the base value of the property that you are animating.

    For more information about animation composition, see the Animation and Timing System Overview. For more information about creating custom animation types, see the Custom Animations Overview.
